text: Luis Benjamín Cordero y Crespo (6 April 1833 - 30 January 1912) was President of Ecuador 1 July 1892 to 16 April 1895. His parents were Gregorio Cordero and Josefa Crespo. He was a member of the Progresistas, a liberal Catholic political party, and was a member of the provisional governing junta which led the Progresistas to power in 1883. Luis Cordero wrote poems in Spanish and Kichwa and published the first Kichwa-Spanish-Kichwa dictionary in Ecuador. ==Other websites== * Official Website of the Ecuadorian Government about the country President's History *¡Rinimi, Llacta! - Poems of Luis Cordero Crespo in Quichua, with Spanish translation Category:1833 births Category:1912 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Presidents of Ecuador Category:South American poets
title: Luis Cordero Crespo
